title: Man tried to blackmail teen he met on Grndr into sending him naked pictures
text:
Daniel Brown, 43, met the victim on gay dating app Grindr (Picture: Getty)

A café worker tried to blackmail a teenage boy into sending him nude photos after meeting him on a gay dating app.

Daniel Brown, 43, from Kenley, near Croydon, was initially sent naked images by the 17-year-old boy on Grindr.

Brown ‘turned nasty’ when the teenager tried to break off contact after a few days and demanded more photos, Guildford Crown Court heard.

He threatened to publish the sexual images he had already received if he did not get the nude pictures.

Brown, who works at his mother’s cafe for £7.50 an hour, had denied blackmail but was convicted by a jury and has since accepted his guilt and written a letter of apology.

He was sentenced at Guildford Crown Court (Picture: Google)

Judge Peter Moss, sentencing Brown, told him: ‘When he tried to break off the relationship that you thought was building after only a few days, you turned nasty and you threatened him that unless he sent more physical images of himself to you, you would publish the others.

‘He is a vulnerable man, now some years on because the offence was in December of 2017.’

He added: ‘Your client has been convicted of a serious criminal offence and he is not the victim of it.

‘Everybody sees him as a ‘kindest, most good person’, but this offence shows that there is a dark side to him.

‘What I do know is that he is a liar, capable of telling really good lies. It has been revealed that actually he cannot be trusted.’

Brown was given a two-year community order, including 30 Rehabilitation Activity Requirement days, 37 days on a programme and was ordered to pay £2,000 towards the cost of his prosecution.
